$  Separator = ';' 
)

Function loads additional settings.

Parameters:
$Settings - Data with settings. Format: setting1=value1;setting2=value2;setting3=value3...settingn=valuen If the variable $Settings is equal to false or '' exception would not be thrown.
$Separator - Separator for keys.

Definition at line 128 of file settings.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( isset( $this->SettingsList[ $SettingName ] ) === false )
                        {
                              return;
                        }
                        
                        $NewSettingsList = array();
                        foreach( $this->SettingsList as $Key => $Value )
                        {
                              if( $Key !== $SettingName )
                              {
                                    $NewSettingsList[ $Key ] = $Value;
                              }
                        }
                        $this->SettingsList = $NewSettingsList;
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )

                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->SettingsList !== false )
                        {
                              if( isset( $this->SettingsList[ $SettingName ] ) )
                              {
                                    return( $this->SettingsList[ $SettingName ] );
                              }
                        }
                        if( $DefaultValue === '_throw_exception' )
                        {

                        }

process_settings ( $  Settings  )

$Settings - Settings.

Exception An exception of this type is thrown.
Author:
Dodonov A.A.

Definition at line 220 of file settings.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        foreach( $Settings as $s )
                        {
                              $Tmp = explode( '=' , $s );
                              if( isset( $Tmp[ 1 ] ) === true )
                              {
                                    $this->SettingsList[ $Tmp[ 0 ] ] = $Tmp[ 1 ];
                              }
                              elseif( isset( $Tmp[ 0 ] ) === true && isset( $Tmp[ 1 ] ) === false )
                              {
                                    $this->SettingsList[ $Tmp[ 0 ] ] = true;
                              }
                              elseif( isset( $Tmp[ 0 ] ) === false )
                              {
                                    $Settings = serialize( $Settings );
                                    $s = serialize( $s );
                                    $Tmp = serialize( $Tmp );
                                    throw_exception( "Settings : $Settings s : $s Tmp : $Tmp Illegal settings string" );
                              }
                        }
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }
            }

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->SettingsList === false )
                        {
                              $this->SettingsList = array();
                        }
                        
                        if( $Object->get_setting( $SettingName , false ) !== false )
                        {
                              $this->SettingsList[ $SettingName ] = $Object->get_setting( $SettingName );
                        }
                        elseif( $DefaultValue == '_ignore_unset' )
                        {
                              return;

$  PackageVersion,
$  FileName,
$  SettingName,
$  Value 
)

Function loads setting for package.

$FileName - File's name from directory 'conf' for the specified package.

$Value - Value for setting.
Exceptions:
Exception An exception of this type is thrown.
Author:
Dodonov A.A.

Definition at line 686 of file settings.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->CachedMultyFS === false )
                        {
                              $this->CachedMultyFS = get_package( 'cached_multy_fs' , 'last' , __FILE__ );
                        }
                        
                        $ClassName = get_class( $this );
                        
                        $S = new $ClassName;
                        $S->load_package_settings( $PackageName , $PackageVersion , $FileName );
                        $S->set_setting( $SettingName , $Value );
                        
                        $PackagePath = _get_package_path_ex( $PackageName , $PackageVersion );
                        $this->CachedMultyFS->file_put_contents( "$PackagePath/conf/$FileName" , $S->get_all_settings() );
                  }

transform_settings ( $  Settings,
$  Separator 
)

Function transforms settings string.

Parameters:
$Settings - Settings.
$Separator - Separator.
Exceptions:
Exception An exception of this type is thrown.
Author:
Dodonov A.A.

Definition at line 175 of file settings.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( strpos( $Settings , "\r" ) !== false )
                        {
                              $Settings = str_replace( "\r" , $Separator , $Settings );
                        }
                        
                        if( strpos( $Settings , "\n" ) !== false )
                        {
                              $Settings = str_replace( "\n" , $Separator , $Settings );
                        }
                        
                        if( strpos( $Settings , $Separator.$Separator ) !== false )
                        {
                              $Settings = str_replace( $Separator.$Separator , $Separator , $Settings );
                        }
                        
                        return( explode( $Separator , $Settings ) );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }
            }
